text: pythonic way to convert variable to list
I have a function whose input argument can either be an element or a list of elements.
If this argument is a single element then I put it in a list so I can iterate over the input in a consistent manner.

code:
def my_func(input):
    if not isinstance(input, list): input = [input]
    for e in input:
        ...

text: I am working with an existing API so I can't change the input parameters.
Using isinstance() feels hacky, so is there a proper way to do this?
